content:
I'm glad you're excited to start writing!

As for your question, I would recommend focusing solely on the memory and sensory details in this piece. The fact that you've been writing regularly for three months is a great accomplishment, but it might not be directly relevant to the memory of your grandmother's kitchen.

By focusing on the sensory details and emotions associated with the memory, you'll create a more immersive and engaging experience for your readers. You want to transport them to your grandmother's kitchen, not distract them with extraneous information.

Save the reflection on your writing progress for a separate piece or a personal journal entry. This way, you can celebrate your accomplishment without detracting from the emotional impact of your descriptive paragraph.

Remember, the goal of this exercise is to evoke emotions and create a vivid scene using sensory language. Keep your focus on the memory, and trust that your writing will shine through.

Go ahead and write that paragraph, and don't hesitate to share it with me if you'd like feedback or guidance!
